commentary_central: The BoJ continues to wait for more evidence of Trump’s impact and avoids being forced to tighten by yen weakness
commentary_higher: BoJ imposes back-to-back rate rises after serious dislocation in currency markets requires tighter monetary policy to restore stability
commentary_lower: The BoJ lowers rates to respond to sudden economic threats

commentary_central: The BoJ raises rates in March having received the reassurance it needed that wages were growing reasonably, economic activity was holding up and Trump was not a severe risk to the Japanese economy
commentary_higher: Rapid wage growth and sharp yen weakening prompts the BoJ to opt for back-to-back rate increases
commentary_lower: The BoJ maintains a tightening bias but decides to wait for more information on wages and activity in the nervous first few months of a Trump US presidency

commentary_central: The BoJ assesses that wage growth inflation trends are on track following spring wage negotiations but wants to normalise rates slowly
commentary_higher: Wage trends and inflation meet the BoJ’s expectations, allowing it to set a faster path of normalisation
commentary_lower: The BoJ continues to hold rates in response to weaker wage and inflation developments or increased risks from an external shock such as trade tariffs

commentary_central: The BoJ assesses that wage growth inflation trends are still on track and can take another step towards normalisation in the second half of 2025
commentary_higher: Above trend growth and a falling yen spark inflationary pressures in excess of the BoJ’s desires forcing a faster rise in interest rates
commentary_lower: The BoJ continues to hold rates in response to weaker wage and inflation developments or increased risks from an external shock such as trade tariffs

commentary_central: The BoJ assesses that wage growth inflation trends are on track following spring wage negotiations and continues to push rates higher very slowly
commentary_higher: The BoJ becomes confident that wages and prices will reinforce one another and seeks a more normal range for interest rates
commentary_lower: The BoJ holds rates in response to weaker wage and inflation developments or increased risks from an external shock such as trade tariffs

commentary_central: The BoJ assesses that wage growth inflation trends are on track following spring wage negotiations and continues to push rates higher very slowl
commentary_higher: The BoJ becomes confident that wages and prices will reinforce one another and seeks a more normal range for interest rates
commentary_lower: The BoJ holds rates in response to weaker wage and inflation developments or increased risks from an external shock such as trade tariffs

commentary_central: Interest rates converge on a relatively low neutral rate.
commentary_higher: A successful emergence from decades of weak growth and inflation would require higher neutral interest rates.
commentary_lower: Japan falls back into its low inflation trap, failing to generate domestic inflation and wage growth.
